repository.orgName: Staats- und Universitätsbibliothek Hamburg Carl von Ossietzky

msContents.summary: The manuscript contains commentary on famous Sanskrit Lexicon Amarakośa. The commentary is in Kannada language. The texts ends with the Avyayavarga of the Amarakośa.

msItem.title: Amaraṭīkā
msItem.incipit: (1v 1) urṇuṇauto tava vidvahotṛṇu?sya śekharañca namo talāśritaṃ [bhaktaśaktavṛdhyartaṃ na he sunu] a (1v 2) marā ye bahumoda
msItem.explicit: (124v 6) ?va pratyak pamaravaṇadhikati tanvī vadhū vaṇadeśadanvi agranappakāladanvi dunvīva

support.p: Front wooden guard folio back folio is palm leaf. the back folio is broken sides. Many wormholes. Two lines in Granth are written on the first blank folio. Line 1 sevyassūrāṇāṃ sevyassūrāṇāṃhimavaṣipādaḥ ssaṃbhāvati yassudhāśivenanāmabhid ??patamopa line 2 ? dviyaṃ komudidipyanadiṃprastute.

supportDesc.foliation: Tamil letter numbers in the left margin. 1v-124
supportDesc.condition: Many folio with wormholes and sides are broken.

handNote.desc: charactors are spread but still difficult to read.

additions.desc: Front guard folio has mark of scraped glued paper, number 99 is written on in pink pencil in left margin, right margin and at the centre.

binding.p: White thrade used to tie the manuscript.

encodingDesc.p: Square bracket is used to show illegible syllables or words. Space is added to separate words.

TEI.text:
(1v 1) śrimaterāmānujāya namaḥ . urṇuṇauto tava vidvahotṛṇu?sya śekharañca namo talāśritaṃ [bhaktaśaktavṛdhyartaṃ na he sunu] a (1v 2) marā ye bahumoda
(124v 6) ?va pratyak pamaravaṇadhikati tanvī vadhū vaṇadeśadanvi agranappakāladanvi dunvīva ityavyayavarggaḥ . śrīgaṇeśāyanamaḥ
